# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = String[]
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = word
        else
            line *= word * " "
        end
    end

    push!(lines, line)
    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
wrap_string("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.", 15)
```

This `wrap_string` function takes a text as an argument with a default text width of 10 characters. It splits the text into words, then iterates through each word. If adding the current word would cause the line length to exceed the text width, it starts a new line and appends the current word to it. After processing all the words, it returns the wrapped string as a single string with newline characters (`\n`) between each line.
